body_html:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/common_shape_fns.cc#L19 is the implementation the runtime uses. For the first case, a negative padding is clipped to 0, though what it means is that the windows do not cover the entire input because you couldn't satisfy the 'output size' for SAME if you tried.

As for the second: Let's say our 19 values are:

A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S

We are selecting filter size of 1 and stride of 2, so we get:
A C E G I K M O Q S

which are 10 values.

Feel free to update our documentation if you think there's something better we can do, but I don't think there's a bug here?

For the first case, a negative padding is clipped to 0, though what it means is that the windows do not cover the entire input because you couldn't satisfy the 'output size' for SAME if you tried.

As for the second:  Let's say our 19 values are:

A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S

We are selecting filter size of 1 and stride of 2, so we get:

which are 10 values.
